CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 12, 1954, pg. 26, reads: "Youngsters Play Benefit - in picture, left to right, are the principals who appeared in a benefit game for Roger McCollum, son of a Little League umpire, the late John McCollum, who died while arbitrating a league game last week. They are Neal Ramsey, Amvets; McCollum, Elks; Charles Franklin, Fireman's Department Store; Donald Craven, Pittsburgh Lions, and Carl E. Redwood, vice president of the league.  Proceeds of the benefit game, sponsored by the Uptown Little League Association, were turned over to young McCollum."
TitMainTitle: Little League baseball players, from left: Amvets Neal Ramsey, Northside Elks Roger McCollum, Fireman's Department Store Charles Franklin, and Pittsburgh Lions Donald Craven, standing with Carl E. Redwood in front of concrete grandstand near Bedford Avenue, Lower Hill District
